H0.text: Classifying the recovered items by the type of item is the best method to determine the history of the different people who may have lived at the site, as scientists, volunteers, and students collect items used by people living hundreds of years ago at an archaeological dig site.

H1.text: By the size of the item is the best method to classify the recovered items at an archaeological dig site where scientists, volunteers, and students collect artifacts used by people living hundreds of years ago in order to determine the history of the different people who may have lived at the site.

H2.text: Classifying the recovered items by the person who located the item is the best method for determining the history of the different people who may have lived at the archaeological dig site where scientists, volunteers, and students collect items used by people living hundreds of years ago.

H3.text: Classifying recovered items by the soil layer where the item was found is the best method for determining the history of the different people who may have lived at the archaeological dig site.

A4.text: Stratigraphy is primarily used in the study of sedimentary and layered volcanic rocks.

A5.text: The basic concept in stratigraphy, called the law of superposition, states: in an undeformed stratigraphic sequence, the oldest strata occur at the base of the sequence.
